skill.name: template-skill
skill.description: Replace with description of the skill and when Claude should use it.
skill.summary: Replace with description of the skill and when Claude should use it.
skill.author: ArtemisAI

security_audit.summary: This is a template skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities are present. The SKILL.md file is purely declarative with YAML frontmatter and instructions.

content.value_statement: Building skills from scratch takes time and careful structure. This template provides a standardized starting point with proper formatting and metadata. Developers can quickly create new skills without worrying about structure.
actual_capabilities: Provides standardized skill structure for new skills
Includes YAML frontmatter for metadata configuration
Defines category and tag taxonomy for organization
Supports multiple AI platforms (Claude, Codex, Claude Code)
Enables version tracking and license specification
limitations: This is a template, not a functional skill
Requires customization to become a working skill
No built-in functionality beyond structural guidance
Must be combined with additional code or prompts

use_cases.title: Build new skills
use_cases.description: Start new skill projects with proper structure and metadata configuration.

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Create consistent skill formats across your AI tool development projects.

use_cases.title: Contribute templates
use_cases.description: Share your own skill templates following marketplace conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [name] that helps with [task]. Use the template structure and include proper metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Category selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a template skill for [category] tasks. Include relevant tags and describe when to use it.

prompt_templates.title: Platform targeting
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a template skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Define the shared capabilities across platforms.

prompt_templates.title: Custom extension
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend the template with custom [capability]. Include documentation and example prompts for users.

output_examples.input: Create a markdown preview skill using this template
output: Skill structure created with: SKILL.md (metadata + instructions)
Compatible with: Claude, Codex, Claude Code

best_practices: Customize the description to clearly explain when Claude should use this skill.
Select the most relevant category from the supported list for proper organization.
Include specific, actionable instructions in the main body for consistent results.
Add version information to track changes across skill updates.
anti_patterns: Leaving template placeholders unchanged without customization.
Using vague descriptions that do not explain skill purpose.
Skipping metadata frontmatter which enables marketplace discovery.
Creating skills without clear instructions for Claude behavior.

faq.question: What platforms support this template?
faq.answer: The template supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Modify supported_tools in frontmatter to target specific platforms.

faq.question: How do I customize this template?
faq.answer: Edit the YAML frontmatter with your skill name, description, category, and tags. Add your instructions below the frontmatter section.

faq.question: Can I add code files to this template?
faq.answer: Yes. Place executable files like JavaScript or Python in the same directory. Reference them from your SKILL.md instructions.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this template?
faq.answer: This template only contains static documentation. No code execution, file access, or network calls are performed.

faq.question: Why is my skill not working?
faq.answer: Ensure frontmatter is properly formatted with three dashes. Check that description explains when to use the skill. Verify instructions are clear.

faq.question: How does this compare to other skill formats?
faq.answer: This template follows the standardized skill structure for the AI skill marketplace. Other formats may have different requirements.
